title: The Last Letter from Verona
premise: A renowned but jaded book conservator is hired to restore a crumbling 19th-century library in Italy, only to discover its reclusive owner is the brilliant historian who ghosted her a decade ago after a life-altering summer romance. Bound by a contract and a mutual, unresolved passion for the library's secrets, they must work together to save the collection, unearthing a hidden cache of love letters that eerily mirrors their own past. Each restored page forces them to confront the devastating truth of why they were torn apart, and to decide if some stories—and some loves—are worth a risky, final edit.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a meticulous conservator who protects her heart as carefully as she preserves priceless paper, still haunted by the one person who saw through her perfect restorations to her own cracks.
conflict: Elara must work alongside Leo, the man who shattered her trust, to save the library, all while battling their resurgent chemistry and the painful mystery of his past abandonment. The central conflict is whether to risk her carefully rebuilt life for a truth that could either be their redemption or a final, deeper heartbreak.
setting: Present-day, in a secluded, decaying villa and its private library in the hills of Verona, Italy, with flashbacks to their sun-drenched first meeting there ten years prior.
tone: Atmospheric, wistful, and emotionally charged, blending the lush romance of rediscovery with the poignant tension of old wounds and the quiet thrill of uncovering hidden histories.
